I found this the other day:
 
 "Philosophy is to the real world as masturbation is to sex." 
 -- Karl Marx
 
 Well, simply put - do you agree?
I like that. I guess I sort of agree with that.
But with every lie, there is a sliver of truth. And no, I don't agree. Philosophy is a way of explaining the world. I mean, you could say the same thing about anything.
Yeah...the whole truth thing is fairly elusive...and, i don't know, maybe it;s even open to interpretation. can truth be more than one thing? Or one thing that different people see differently?

Yeah...the whole truth thing is fairly elusive...and, i don't know, maybe it;s even open to interpretation. can truth be more than one thing? Or one thing that different people see differently?

 
 I see truth as having to be universal, because if truth has more than one meaning, than isn't truth a lie in itself?

"Any clod can have the facts. Having an opinion is an art." - Charles McCabe
 
 In my opinion, we should be able to explain WHY we believe what we believe.
 
 Pete

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Philosophy Quote
